title: View another user information with IDOR vulnerability
content:
1- Navigate to the system. (https://██████████/login.php)
2- Navigate to register page. (https://██████████████/register.php)(i created user, username:██████ pass: TEst.123.!)
3- Login to the system. (https://███/login.php)
4- Navigate to "My Profile Page".
5- Intercept the request.
6- Change the "UID2=4820038" cookie value with "UID2=4820036".
7- Send the request to server.
8- View another user information.
Impact
I can view another user information.
steps: Navigate to the system and register a new user.
Log in and intercept the request on the 'My Profile Page'.
Modify the 'UID2' cookie value to another user's ID and send the request.
Observe the response containing another user's information.
vuln_description: This vulnerability allows an attacker to view another user's information by manipulating the 'UID2' cookie value in the request, exploiting an Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) issue.
reason: The attack involves straightforward steps of intercepting and modifying a single cookie value, which is a common and well-documented vulnerability pattern. No complex interactions or novel logic is required.

authnz_metadata.reasoning: The vulnerability involves modifying the 'UID2' cookie value to access another user's profile. This aligns with the IDOR methodology where a resource_id (UID) is substituted in a request using an authenticated session. The automated methodology would detect this by testing different resource_ids (step 4e) and verifying if the authorization boundary is crossed, making it a simple AuthN/AuthZ bypass case.
